meanings.definition: relating to or involving a change in substance
meanings.sent1: The potion had a transubstantial effect on the color of the liquid.
meanings.sent2: The transubstantial alteration in the recipe made the cake taste completely different.
meanings.sent3: The transubstantial shift in the weather turned a sunny day into a stormy one.
meanings.sent4: Her transubstantial makeover for the party left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The transubstantial growth of the plant amazed the gardener.

meanings.definition: of or relating to the belief in the literal transformation of the bread and wine into the body and blood of Christ in the Eucharist
meanings.sent1: The transubstantial nature of the ceremony was deeply meaningful to the attendees.
meanings.sent2: The transubstantial ritual symbolized a profound spiritual connection.
meanings.sent3: The transubstantial concept of communion sparked a lively discussion among the theologians.
meanings.sent4: His transubstantial faith in the miracle of Eucharist was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The transubstantial significance of the sacrament was evident in the reverence of the congregation.
